metadata.synopsis: Raphael tells Astarion about the contract Cazador made with a devil to become a super vampire.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Raphael's Revelation (camp night)Take a long rest

47.speaker: Raphael
47.text: Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?

59.speaker: Raphael
59.text: It returns to the hells - to the very point where it last stood before venturing to whichever devilforsaken plane it died on.

53.speaker: Raphael
53.text: In the case of our friend Yurgir, the orthon you so handily dispatched in the temple of Shar, he manifested in my House of Hope.

24.speaker: Raphael
24.text: He returned to me chastened but intact, his wounds healed, his body restored.

8.speaker: Raphael
8.text: He thought I would dismember him but he has his uses so instead I am reeducating him.
8.context: NodeContext: with a sadistic grin, relishing what you did to this creature that is no longer 'intact'

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: We delivered the devil. Now I want what I'm owed - we had a deal.

33.speaker: Raphael
33.text: Indeed we did. I discovered all there is to know about those scars of yours - it's a rather grim tale, even for my tastes.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: We had a deal - the orthon for information.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Please, give me more boring details about your plans.

63.speaker: Raphael
63.text: Come now, we're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.

11.speaker: Raphael
11.text: As you wish. Brace yourself, Astarion - we're about to unveil your destiny.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Are you sure you want to know, Astarion? Maybe it's best left in the past.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: Even if I wanted to walk away from all of this, I can't. Cazador won't let me.

69.speaker: Raphael
69.text: And why would he want to walk away? This is his destiny.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: I'd appreciate a little less enthusiasm when it comes to Cazador and his horrors.

16.speaker: Raphael
16.text: Oh come, Astarion. We're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.

20.speaker: Raphael
20.text: As you know already, your precious skin is home to one part of a contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles, and your former master, Cazador Szarr.

44.speaker: Raphael
44.text: In full, the contract states that Cazador will be granted knowledge of an infernal ritual so vile it has never been performed.

15.speaker: Raphael
15.text: It promises to be a marvellous ceremony. Very elaborate, incredibly ancient, and entirely diabolical.

43.speaker: Raphael
43.text: If he completes the rite, he will become a new kind of being - the Vampire Ascendant.

56.speaker: Raphael
56.text: All the strengths of his vampiric form will be amplified, and alongside them he will enjoy the luxuries of the living.

60.speaker: Raphael
60.text: The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike Astarion, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.

1.speaker: Raphael
1.text: The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike you, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.

12.speaker: Raphael
12.text: But the ritual has its price, as all worthwhile things do. Lord Cazador will need to sacrifice a number of souls, including all of his vampiric spawn, if he is to ascend.

76.speaker: Raphael
76.text: Imagine how he felt, then, when one of those precious spawn simply disappeared into thin air.

57.speaker: Raphael
57.text: The only missing ingredient is Astarion.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: You are the final piece he requires to complete the ritual - your scars bind you to it. Your soul will set off a very wave of death, bringing Cazador his twisted life.

67.speaker: Raphael
67.text: And that, my tragic and toothsome friend, is that. Now if you'll excuse me, I have business elsewhere.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears with a click of his fingers and a puff of smokeNodeContext: [Tarik] snaps fingers at the end of the line.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Cazador is a piece of shit. We're going to stop him.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: 'Hmm'? That's all you have to say?

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: I was... contemplating. It's a lot to take in.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: What do you think I should do?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: We can't let Cazador complete that ritual. He could unleash terrible horrors.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: The end of my life among them. Just when I was starting to enjoy it.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I think you should run. If Cazador can't find you, he can't complete his ritual.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: How long do you think I can run? He has eternity to find me.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: He'll never leave me alone. I didn't think he would when I was just one more wretched toy for him to play with.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: But if I'm the key to this power he craves, he'll hunt me to the ends of Faerûn.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You'll never be free while Cazador lives.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: I hate how right you are.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: I knew he wouldn't leave me alone even when I was just another wretched toy for him to play with.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: There's a way to become a living vampire... That must mean a lot to you.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: I could get rid of the worm in my head and still walk in the sun. I'd finally be free of the hunger.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: And if I'm the key to this deal of Cazador's, perhaps I can turn this to my advantage...

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: I need to take the fight to him.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: And I need you to help me.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: After we dealt with our tadpole problem, yes, I'll help you then.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Once we deal with the tadpole, I'll be back to my nocturnal self. When you're being hunted by vampires, the dark is the worst place to hide.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I need to deal with Cazador while I still have any kind of advantage over him.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Of course I'll help. We'll hunt him down and kill him.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: If he comes for you, I'll defend you. But we're not risking an attack on his lair.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: If you won't risk taking him on for my sake, think of the innocent souls he'll sacrifice in this ritual.
71.context: NodeContext: Angry, but keeping it well in control. He didn't get the answer he wanted from the player.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The Absolute is a greater threat - we need to focus.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: You're right - I'll help you destroy him.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: We're done talking about this, Astarion. My decision is made.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.context: NodeContext: angry, but controlling his fury

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You don't need to go back to Cazador - you're with me now.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: Do you think it's so simple?

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: It's a lot to take in.

37.speaker: Raphael
37.text: Carved into that ivory skin of yours is one part of an infernal contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles and your former master, Cazador Szarr.

54.speaker: Raphael
54.text: Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?
